entries.meaning: (chemistry, geology) Any substance or mineral that forms different types of crystal.
(transitive, fiction) The transformation of an item or creature into something different by magic.

verbs.description: polymorph (third-person singular simple present polymorphs, present participle polymorphing, simple past and past participle polymorphed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To transform; to change into another form.
(fiction, transitive, intransitive) To transform into something different by magic.
examples: I got hemmed in by the werewolf again and, in desperation, tried an experimental new wand on it; and polymorphed it into a black pudding.
